# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = string(word)
        else
            current_line *= " $(word)"
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line) # Add last line
    join(lines, "\n") # Join lines with newline character
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very very long string that needs to be wrapped into lines with a maximum width of 10 characters. This is also an example."
println(wrap_string(text))
```
